events.message: The customer reported a car accident involving their vehicle hitting a pole on April 30th around 7 PM in downtown. They provided initial details for filing the claim.
After reviewing the initial claim report, the insurance team classified this case under Auto Accident due to the involvement of the customer's car in the incident.
An agent with experience in vehicle collision cases was assigned to handle this claim to ensure focused and efficient processing.
The customer was contacted and the claim was acknowledged formally, reassuring them that their case is being handled promptly.
The agent requested necessary documents including photos of the damaged vehicle, police report, and repair estimates to proceed with claim evaluation.
The customer submitted all requested documents, including clear images of the collision area and the official police accident report.
The claims investigation team began examining the documentation and details provided to verify the circumstances of the auto accident.
The investigation confirmed the reported details, validating the collision report and verifying the extent of damage to the insured vehicle.
A settlement offer was made to the customer based on repair costs and policy coverage limits, outlining the compensation amount proposed.
The customer expressed satisfaction with the prompt settlement proposal and appreciated the clear communication from the insurance team.
Following customer consent, the claim approval was formally granted, and preparations for payment issuance began without delay.
The settlement payment was transferred to the customer’s bank account to cover vehicle repairs as per the approved claim settlement.
With payment completed and no further queries from the customer, the insurance claim case was officially closed successfully.
The entire claim file was archived within the company’s records for future reference and compliance with regulatory requirements.
